result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) - 7th and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) - 7th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Timothy R Wolfe was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) - 7th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants the defendant 63 days of sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
2:05 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 - OWI - 7th offense.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs - defendant has 63 days of sentence credit.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on OWI-7th offense.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision - consecutive to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS:

-$1000 fine plus court costs.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 36 months
-IID - 36 months
-AODA & follow-up (GL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Sentence to commence immediately.

Court finds the defendant are not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-Court grants the defendant 63 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 2:20 p.m.
Status hearing on December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

12:03 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - requests another status be scheduled.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 20, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 12:04 p.m.

Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:36 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - qualifies for PD representation and will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.

2:17 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant qualifies for PD representation but is not sure he wants representation.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status of Prelim on April 5, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.
